ai.summary: An 11.6 km moderate hike in the UK featuring a route to Lion's Face and Cromlins. The trail combines open moorland, woodland paths, and rocky sections with steady elevation and rewarding views.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain with grassy tracks, muddy forest paths, and rocky stretches. Expect uneven footing, intermittent exposed sections, and potential boggy ground after rain. Good footwear is essential.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before starting. Wear sturdy hiking boots with good grip and bring waterproof clothing. Carry a map and compass or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a whistle. Stay on marked paths, allow extra time for slower sections, and avoid hiking alone in poor visibility.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) offer the best conditions, but the route can be hiked year-round with appropriate winter gear.

seo.title: Lion's Face & Cromlins Hike – 11.6 km Moderate Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Lion's Face & Cromlins hike in the UK. An 11.6 km moderate trail with varied terrain, safety tips, and gear recommendations for a rewarding day on the trail.
